snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, under mounting pressure from anti-European populists, continued to insist on new measures limiting the right of Europeans to live and work there.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel has indicated that she is prepared to contemplate future for European Union without Great Britain, if British Prime Min David Cameron insists on new measures to limit rights of Europeans to live and work there.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from London, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, under mounting pressure from anti-European populists, continued to insist on new measures limiting the right of Europeans to live and work there.

headline.main: Merkel Toughens Position on Britain’s E.U. Demands
headline.print_headline: Merkel Toughens Position on Britain’s E.U. Demands
